ranked_diseases.explanation: Ferguson-Smith Disease, also known as multiple self-healing squamous epithelioma (MSSE), is associated with the development of self-healing tumors resembling squamous cell carcinomas. The presentation of self-healing squamous epithelioma closely matches the phenotype described.

Muir-Torre Syndrome is a variant of Lynch syndrome characterized by sebaceous skin tumors, which can include squamous tumors that may self-resolve. Although more rare, this syndrome could explain the observed phenotype.
